messages.title: Mitcham schools funding commitment
messages.content: The Liberal Democrat manifesto pledges to introduce a 'Pupil Premium' - raising the school funding for the poorest children in Mitcham & Morden.

messages.title: Labour's shameful record
messages.content: Labour's record includes taking the UK into the war in Iraq, raising taxes on the least paid, wasting money on expensive IT failures, and dithering over action on MPs' expenses.

messages.title: Change that works for you
messages.content: Building a fair future means doing something different now. The Liberal Democrats are the only party who are honest about the future costs and are committed to fair taxes that put money back in your pocket.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Supports local primary schools and suggests investing an extra £2.5 billion to cut class sizes, extra tuition, and catch-up classes with a focus on disadvantaged students.
Advocates for green jobs that will not harm the environment, including improvements in energy efficiency at home, investment in public transport and renewable energy.
Wants banks to invest in British businesses and jobs, emphasizing support for interests of industries over their bonus packages.

issues.economy: Building a green economy will provide us with jobs - but will not ruin our environment.
issues.education: Supports investing an extra £2.5 billion for education to provide fair funding to children.
issues.environment: Building a green economy will provide us with jobs - but will not ruin our environment.
issues.governance: Labour's track record noted as negative, including the war in Iraq and taxes on the least paid.

housing.content: We must improve energy efficiency in our homes, invest in public transport and renewable energy.

endorsements.endorsement: Diana Coman has pledged to give every child a fair start in life by investing an extra £2.5bn in our schools which could be used to cut class sizes, offer one-to-one tuition and catch-up classes.
